Reviews.Content: Comfortable with a lovely veiw!       Veiw from our King ocean veiw room
Reviews.Author: bekky-boo

Reviews.Content: Fantastic Beds! Stayed here for just a 1 night stopover. The room was as advertised and very central with easy parking ($20 per night) under the hotel. Bar below hotel served excellent food and is recommended. But the best bit was the really fantastically comfy bed and pillow!! Possibly the best we have experienced in a hotel.
Reviews.Author: CarolPerthWA

Reviews.Content: Good location       Hermy #2
Reviews.Author: AmberGates51

Reviews.Content: Needs to upgrade customer service I didn't book to stay at this hotel as I live 5 minutes away! I booked to have lunch on a Sunday for a birthday celebration. I had seen an obvious old website that they advertised a seafood buffet on different days and called to book....I was informed that they had altered their menu and this was now unavailable. I reserved a table anyway...After arriving at the hotel, we made our way to the restaurant with no help from any staff to guide us. I was greeted with Are you here for the smorgasbord, No I replied,,, I would like to have an a la carte lunch. The waiter took us downstairs to a bar, and asked if we would like to sit outside,,, it was almost cyclonic conditions due to the wind..No, he then proceeded to take us into a bar where the stools are soooooooo high, it was a balancing act to sit on them...It would have been a most uncomfortable dining experience... Not impressed, we walked out. My complaint is.. I should have been told it was a smorgasbord lunch when I booked. It was too late to go to another restaurant without a previous booking.
Reviews.Author: elbee029

Reviews.Content: Give us your money $$$ ... :) Stayed here a few times in the past but seems to have gone downhill since.Reason stay is great location but now the hotels goal is to extract as much money from guests in a rather poor fashion.Use to be free parking now $20 .. they have upgraded rooms marginally but added $100 a night to price .. bathrooms still very poor and very musty .. checking out they do a direct currency conversion and charge you in your cards currency a very sneaky practice that allows them to add 5% to the hotel bill at check out due to the very poor exchange rate they offer .. when questioned regarding this they attitude is we always do this so to hell with you .. had to get them to cancel and put transaction through in dollars..Overall think my last stay at hotel very very disappointing ..
Reviews.Author: magpie707

Reviews.Content: Great Views       Restaurant with views of Coogee
Reviews.Author: Mishella11

Reviews.Content: Great overnight stay in a modern, seaside hotel       Our big, modern room, overlooking tennis court
Reviews.Author: njk17

Reviews.Content: Great location with helpful and friendly staff       Beach across from hotel
Reviews.Author: NC-travel19

Reviews.Content: Excellent service, room and amenities - highly recommended! I booked the Crowne Plaza Coogee through a last minute hotel booking website and got a great deal. Arrived at 11.00am and was expecting to just leave my bags with the concierge but was told my room was ready. Reception staff very polite and helpful. Room was beautiful, 2 double beds, plasma tv, well stocked mini-bar and nice clean bathroom (a bit small if you're fussy about these thing but I found it good enough!). TV has usual channels plus Fox 8 and all the Fox Sports channels. Had a great nights sleep in a very comfortable bed (pilllows and mattress the best hotel stuff I've ever slept on!). Staff helpful and friendly at all times and were willing to help in any way they could.I highly recommend this hotel to anyone. Close to the beautiful beach at Coogee, the main street with cafes and shops and I recommend the coastal walk to everyone - simply stunning.
Reviews.Author: kingt

Reviews.Content: Good Hotel, poor check staff and internet Booked Hotel some months in advance and arrived quite early and before normal check in time and was told NO rooms available, This was Ok until quite a few other people turned up, including two big tour groups, and all were given rooms immediatly. As I am Priorty Club Member I was very unhappy about delay which was caused by multiple reasons,depending on who you spoke to in reception., so many reasons in fact that I did not beleive them and created a scene whereby they pulled an upgraded room immediatly and off we went to sleep after a long flight from London.The internet service in the Hotel is expensive and very slow. It is advertised as High Speed and it went at the same speed as my granny on her walking stick. I complained but nobody in this Hotel seems to understand the needs of buisness people today.The room however was acceptable with a nice Bay view.The bathroom was also too small for two people to share
Reviews.Author: SupramanWeybridge

Reviews.Content: Great views, but... Crowne Plaza at Coogee Beach looks great from outside but inside is a different story;Renovations which their webside claims has been done in 2007, must have been just soft furnishing replacements. In our room the fridge had been leaking for some time causing the cupboard (where it hummed) to be badly damaged. Everything , apart the soft furnishing, is worn out.Rooms are tiny and bathroom even smaller. As we got a ocean view room (excellent views), morning sun was extreamly hot, so the curtains had to be closed all morning. Rooms have air-conditioning, but even that we set the thermo to +18 Celsius and fan on it's highest, the coolest the room got during the night was +22.5 Celsius, stuffy.If wanting to holiday in coastal suburb Coogee, would rather recommend the apartment hotels in area, keeping also in mind that it's hard to find quality restaurant in Coogee.
Reviews.Author: HolidayHot

Reviews.Content: Great Short Break Spot Stayed two nights in late December 2007 with my wife. The location of this hotel is one of it's strongest points. It is located across the road from beautiful Coogee Beach and is surrounded by some fantastic cafes and restaurants.The views from the restaurant are magnificent. The food is of a very high quality and the service is exceptional.The pool was very nice (but a bit cold) and I was disappointed that the spa pool was not heated.All in all - well worth a visit.
Reviews.Author: steve_fossil

Reviews.Content: Average Hotel, Above Average Location (close to beach) This hotel is at Coogee Beach, so not a place to stay if you want to be in Sydney City. Having said that, Coogee is a great place - nice beach, great pub, good local shops. It is less hectic than Bondi.The hotel does everything average and nothing exceptional. Rooms average; Bathroom average (if a little small); Breakfast average; Staff average.
Reviews.Author: HK71

Reviews.Content: Warning I find it very high price for the value.Be careful they sell ocean view rooms which actually have ocean view only on the edge of the balcony.I asked to change and then they offered me another room with a smaller bed, no bathtub but with ocean view but with an annoying plane like noise on the roof (I was staying in the last floor).The rest (cleaniness, bathroom,...) is ok but not exceptionnal.The staff may be arrogant sometime...
Reviews.Author: Living_in_Hotels

Reviews.Content: Good Conference Hotel Stayed here in for a work conference - rooms reasonably sized given I was sharing with someone else. Bathroom small. Conference room for larger parties (we had 23 people) are just 2 rooms with the dividing wall opened, but this didn't open right up so we spent a lot of the time trying to look around the wall. Buffet breakfast is OK - dishes not replaced nearly quickly enough, and an average spread as well.
Reviews.Author: Debmic

Reviews.Content: It's about the beach and the pool. I really enjoyed this hotel. It's not a hotel you stay in for it's ownsake, it's the 2 minute walk to the beach and the lovely pool that make this place work. The location is just great (although it's ruinedthe landscape of the town), my room was very good - nice big bed, balcony views over the ocean and the pool. The only problem with the room was that the TV didn't have any international channels tuned in.The staff we're OK, but they suffered the usual Holiday Inn front deskproblems of seeming to always be too busy doing other things like paperwork and answering phones to look after their guests really well.
Reviews.Author: ChelseaTraveller

Reviews.Content: Crowne Plaza Coogee Beach - Nice but Flawed We found the Crowne Plaza Coogee Beach to be nice. Its location was perfect: near the beach and many eateries on adjacent streets, and away from the hustle of downtown Sydney. The rooms were recently refurbished, although this consisted mostly of new carpet and fresh paint. The staff was very nice and helpful. Our only issue was the cockroach in the bathroom in the middle of the night. I know it's tough to keep pests out of a large hotel, but this was the first time I've ever seen a cockroach in my travels.
Reviews.Author: Teevskis

Reviews.Content: Great location We stayed at this hotel twice within a fortnight (three nights each time). It wasn't cheap but it was really well located, close to Coogee Beach with a great view from the balcony, close to an excellent range of eating places and easy to get to the city. Bus stops at the door. Staff were helpful and pleasant. A buffet breakfast was included for one of our stays but was not of a really high standard - unless it is included as part of a package we would recommend eating in one of the local cafes. Undercover parking was available but quite expensive.
Reviews.Author: Eric_and_Dora

Reviews.Content: Typical Inferior Crowne Plaza I am sorry to say that the Coogee Beach Crowne Plaza, in spite of it's execellent location, failed to impress as an international class hotel that they Crowne Plaza would like you to beleive. The rooms were small, the hotel a bit shabby, with dingy carpeting and marred woodwork and walls in the rooms. Cheap bedding made for an unconfortable night.I was travelling on business, and my company does a great deal of business with CP, particularly this location. The hotel was at partial capacity due to the winter season, yet the hotel stafff would not provide me with upgraded accomodations without payment of a substantial increased cost, a cost which could not be justified as I was travelling on business. I know that the accomodations were available since my colleague received an upgrade after I requested one.The location was excellent because of the close proximity to Coogee Town (retaurants etc) and the easy access to the coastal walks. However, for access to downtown Syndney this location is not recommended. Also, it is no closer to the aiport than is downtown Sydney, and it actually takes longer to get to here from the airport due to the lack of easy public transportation (cabs only)
Reviews.Author: SavvyTravellerIL

Reviews.Content: Great location and very good value for money Great hotel where we spent our last night before leaving Australia (airport is not far) enjoying the beach, hotel's restaurant, room comfort, etc.Everything started well with an excellent welcome. Although I had no reservation, a 2-bed room on the last floor was promptly found for us, and breakfasts got included for free when I showed my Priority Club card (nice surprise). Check-in was a breeze, luggage was taken from our car by front desk clerk himself, and by time we parked our car and reached our room, our suitcases had been delivered there.Spotless clean room with everything we could need. As some previous reviewers notices, bathroom is rather small (by the way, it included a yellow plastic duck toy for the children to play with in the bath - nice touch ! - and weight scales (for parents ?!)).Hotel seems brand-new and is just in front of the beach (direct access to the street we just had to cross to go swimming!).Coogee beach is one of Sydney's greatest beaches, just south of Bondi, and you can make nice walks along the sea shore from there.We had dinner at the hotel's restaurant (nice but a bit noisy due to the adjacent bar). Breakfast was the usual buffet, but we had tables overlooking the beach!Only flaws: no delivery at room of the complimentary daily newspaper (minor flaw since papers could be taken at front desk); no later check-out option offered to us (if we except the 1 hour free delay offered to all Priority Club members - another reason to enroll). Front desk told us there was a 20$/hour rate for delayed check out, whatever the hotel real need for the room. This seems mean-minded and we left before being charged. Most hotels accept 1-2 hour delay if room is not immediately booked by next party. Sofitel offers 4p.m. checkout for Sofitel Privilege card holders.
Reviews.Author: Eric_Beylon

Reviews.Content: Great location overlooking the Pacific We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights as part of a trip around Australia, and thoroughly enjoyed our stay there. We wanted a good hotel close enough to Sydney City Centre to visit each day but offering a beachside location and this hotel ticked all the boxes!The hotel is in a great location, overlooking Coogee Beach. The reception area is spacious and impressive and the staff are friendly and efficient. We had booked and ocean view suite which had a separate lounge area opening out onto a good sized balcony with uninterrupted views over the beach and the Pacific Ocean. The room was clean, well equipped including a well stocked mini bar, room safe, robes and a good bathroom.A very good buffet breakfast (choice of continental or full) was served in the Hotel restaurant with views overlooking the Ocean. There was also a residents bar, and on the lower (street) level a further restaurant and bar (named the Cushion Bar) which was open to non residents and which had a good menu - the bar itself mainly catered for a younger clientele.The hotel concierge service was very good, arranging hire car for us and giving advice whenever we needed it.Coogee Beach is a lovely area, the beach itself being spotlessly clean and the whole area very well kept. There are beautiful walks along the cliffs and it is possible to walk from Coogee to nearby Bondi. There is a very good choice of restaurants within easy walking distance of the hotel.The hotel is a 15 minute taxi ride from Circular Quay (cost about $25.00), and is therefore ideally located to both see the city and to relax by the pool or beach if you want time off from sightseeing.Whilst we were there the hotel was hosting a couple of conferences, which seems to be commonplace for this hotel, and you can expect some minor reorganisation of the public areas to accommodate the conferences, although that did not cause us any problems. We would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Sydney for a few days and we intend to return in the future.
Reviews.Author: farrj

Reviews.Content: Loved it! I stayed here for ten days before xmas 2005 and loved it. After a very stressful year Cooge Beach gave me just the relaxation I needed.The room was good, the view was good, the food great and I loved the fact that I could keep the balcony doors open and fall asleep to the sound of the Pacific surf (and, no, there were no bugs). I also had all the privacy I needed.The service was very good indeed, in fact pretty much what I would expect of a 5 star hotel. I do not have a single complaint. Don't know what some of the negative comments have been about... maybe some people just don't want to be happy? Tip: Join the locals and do the walk up along the coast towards Bondi in the morning. It is an amazingly beautiful walk, and there's a remarkable cemetary along the way. I also love the Aussies as they jog past you at the crack of dawn, only to run past you again ten minutes later on their way down to the nearest beach for a dip before breakfast and work (yes, before work!).That reminds me, I also met locals to hang out with simply by going for lunch, and even on the bus coming back from town!
Reviews.Author: ThisIsMe2two

Reviews.Content: Great location, small room, tiny bathroom       Oceanview room from 4th floor
Reviews.Author: hotelbrat

Reviews.Content: Christmas in Coogee! We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights over Christmas 2006 as part of our honeymoon. The location is great, just across the road from the beach and a few minutes walk to all the shops and restaurants.We had a nice room in a corner position, with 2 balconies (one very large one, more like a roof terrace) both of which had great sea/beach views. The room was a good size and had a nice bed with a duvet rather than blankets. Its wasn't the most flashy/luxurious of decor (although inoffensive) and I would agree that for the price you pay it is maybe due a re-decoration to make it more modern/contemporary. The rooms were clean and quite spacious, although our bathroom was small. The bars and restaurants are very nice. The breakfast was great, a really big variety of hot and cold food. We didn't eat in the main restaurant for dinner but we ate in the Cushion bar, where you can get pizza, fajitas, fish and chips etc. The staff we encountered were all very helpful. I would recommend this hotel, it seemed better than any others in Coogee.
Reviews.Author: UKCarolineH

Reviews.Content: Poor service, poor value, disappointing Disappointed on arrival. Booked through the hotel and they told me that I booked for december not november - even though I had the booking confirmation with me. It was sorted out very quickly but set the tone for the rest of the stay. The place is a typical 'conference hotel', rooms a little shabby, service below standard. We ordered room service and I found 2 pieces of chewed up paper in my soup. Drank the water from the mini bar on the first night and it was not replaced for the rest of the trip despite our frequent reminders to the staff. When I tried to buy some water from the bar instead I was told that they didn't sell it?!? Also found two large cockroaches in the bedroom on separate occassions. Overall very disappointed - would definitely not stay there or recommend any of my friends to go there. Instead the hotel next door, Dive, looked small, friendly and inviting - will give that a go next time.
Reviews.Author: Loop118

Reviews.Content: Great Location! We spent two nights at this property and enjoyed it. The location makes it as it is just across a small street from the beach.Our room was a small suite with a balcony facing the ocean. A bit of caution about these balconies, however. Immediately after checking in early in the evening I opened the sliding door and stepped out onto the balcony. At exactly the same time a semi-naked woman did the same thing on the balcony to our left! She had just jumped out of the shower with a towel covering only her mid-section. We were both rather surprised -- her more than me! These balconies are very close together especially our room with a balcony wedged between two others at a strange angle.The room was nice and it had a huge tub. It even came with a rubber ducky!The hotel's breakfast buffet was reasonably priced and tasty. There's a very nice restaurant just across the street that we would highly recommend for dinner. It's called Deep Blue. Try the kangaroo and crocodile! We did!The hotel has a nice pool and overall it was a good experience although the room could have perhaps used some updating. It just had kind of an old feel to it.
Reviews.Author: newspro

Reviews.Content: Good Booked the Crowne Plaza Coogee using their own website. It's only about a 20 min taxi ride from the airport and we checked in without any problems. Had a Seaview Suite, with a great view of Coogee from the balcony. Room was a good size, clean, with TV, bathrobes, iron/ironing board, mini-bar, good size bathroom etc. Hotel is in a good location at one end of Coogee, only a couple of mins walk from the beach or bars/restaurants.Only criticisms are with the staff, the concierge wasn't particularly helpful when I asked him about buses into the city (in fact I felt he was looking down his nose a bit because I was asking about buses). The staff in the restaurant at breakfast were also either a bit eager, taking away cups/plates which either hadn't been used or weren't finished with, or a bit lax in not cleaning tables once they'd been finished so you had no clean table to sit at. Also one afternoon I spotted a dead cockroach in one of the hotel corridors and it was still there the next day.Overall it was a good hotel and I'd stay there again though.
Reviews.Author: Happynoodleboy_uk

Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great location We stayed here for a long weekend recently. Check-in was fine they quickly dealt with my request to make up the sofa bed for our daughter. Check out was also easy. The room was clean and of reasonable size, although we had asked for an ocean view and the position of our room was such that we had a partial ocean view which was a little disappointing. The bathroom was clean with a large spa bath and nice toiletries. The location of the hotel is perfect for the beach. All you have to do is walk downstairs and cross the road and you are right on Coogee beach. Given it was the middle of winter, there weren't many people around despite it being around 20 degrees. The beach is clean and there it is a reasonable shopping strip nearby. It is also patrolled by lifesavers and so quite safe to swim. There were a number of people doing laps out in the water. There is also one of the man-made pools down one end of the beach which is more protected. We had dinner in the restaurant on two of the three nights we were there. The first night was Friday night and the menu read really well, but the food we had was perhaps not quite as good as we might have expected. It wasn't bad or anything, just probably around 7 out of 10. Saturday night was a completely different story with a fantastic seafood buffet, with loads of fresh seafood and other food. It is definitely worth going to and make sure you book as it can get very busy. If you would like to eat outside the hotel, there are lots of little restaurants around the place within walking distance. We had breakfast each morning in the hotel and it was a pretty good hotel buffet.We went swimming in the pool, which was clean and well looked after. The beach/pool towels are provided for you and changed every day if you wish.My only gripe was that I went downstairs to get some extra sugar, and was told that some would be sent up immediately and it never came. That was really pretty minor in the context of what was a very nice weekend.I would certainly stay there again, as it is so well located for the beach and is a very nice hotel.
Reviews.Author: Feeber

Reviews.Content: Horrible - Avoid The Crowne Plaza Coogee Beach Hotel is a tired, poor hotel that I would not recommend. When checking in, the staff member didn't smile, nor welcome us to the hotel. As we walked to the room, tried the swipe card and it didn't work. Several attempts, and we were grumpy from a flight, yielded nothing - so back down the elevator to get another key that worked.I had selected an 'ocean view' rate. Definitely a nice view of beautiful Coogee Beach during the daytime, but beware - this hotel is directly under a flight path that is sometimes used until 11pm and from 6am onwards (East-West runway at Sydney airport).I really don't get the rave reviews that other travellers have posted on this forum. This hotel used to be a Holiday Inn and it shows - the tables are chipped, the sofa's from the 80's, and the beds uncomfortable. For the price, NEVER again. Try the Coogee Bay Boutique Hotel (just down the street) instead.
Reviews.Author: SamW_DC

Reviews.Content: Great view Just spent a winter weekend at Coogee Crown Plaza- winter special deal. Weather and view spectacular- hotel in the ideal spot for beach and local restaurants. Cushion Bar downstairs a great spot too. Room ok- a bit dated and worn and bathroom could do with re-grouting. Breakfast included in price and was excellent . A nice break.
Reviews.Author: marylizowen

Reviews.Content: Nice but pricey This is a very nice hotel, but at $239 AUD, we found it pricey.There is not a lot of accommodation in the area, so we found ourselves paying a lot more than we wanted. This hotel is more geared towards conventions.The breakfast was outstanding and included in the price.
Reviews.Author: NoName47

Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel We stayed at The Crowne Plaza for a week and found the hotel to be wonderful in so many ways. My husband and I and our 8yo daughter shared a lovely ocean view room, which was incredibly clean, well-supplied and was a good size for the three of us. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the restaurant was yummy, but what sets this hotel apart is the relaxed sea-side atmosphere. We alternated between the beach and the hotel pool - both fabulous. It's a great hotel to combine a seaside holiday with Sydney city sightseeing - best of both worlds. We did the sea path walk from Coogee to Bondi Beach (approx 8-9km) via Clovelly and Bronte Beaches - some of the most spectacular views around! We would highly recommend this hotel for families with children - they made our daughter feel very welcome, and although there are no play facilities at the hotel, there is an wonderful playground just north of the Coogee Lifesaving Club, the beach is safe for children and also has a sea bath (sea swimming pool. We would defintely stay at the Crowne Plaza again. (Oh, and Coogee is pronounced with an oo sound as in book not an oo sound as in snooze)
Reviews.Author: G'dayfromOz

Reviews.Content: Very nice indeed Very happy with this hotel. The location was perfect, right on the beach and on the main drag in Coogee. Good directions by the staff so we came straight to it and went straight into the underground park. So easy. The reception area was very grand and impressive, lots of polished marble and big flower arrangements. Our room was nice. Smallish, but comfy, new and clean.Lovely bathrobes! The bathroom was quite spectacular and beautifully appointed. They seemed not to have cheaped on anything. everything worked. The bar downstairs was excellent, lovely views. we really should have dined there too as it looked good.We plan to stay there again, definitely.
Reviews.Author: ant100

Reviews.Content: Sunrise and Breeze We came from the bitter cold of March 2004 in Southern Ontario. Arriving in Coogee in a tropical downpour. We had made other hotel arrangements with a view of the ocean, but found the hotel below our expectations. Leaving our bags at the hotel we wandered down to the beach to discuss the situation. We had no real option but to accept that we would have to stay at least for one night at the below expectations hotel. After travelling for nearly 40 hours we were in no mood to seek an alternate hotel. But as we turned to walk back up Coogee Bay Road, we saw to the south the Crowne Plaza, it looked so secure and welcoming. Turning to me with that look in her eyes, she said let's stay there instead. Upon entering the reception we knew we had found the perfect hotel. Our request for a room was met with a very soft and polite( as only Australian women are ). Sorry there are no vacancies for tonight, but we'll fit you in tomorrow night. Accepting our fate we turned to leave the hotel, but only to hear the voice of a girl we came to callour guardian angel, say. But perhaps we can fit you in somehow tonight. She took us to room 607, what a view, we took it at once and promtly checked in. Collected our bags from the the other hotel. We had intended to stay only a week in Coogee, we stayed 21 days. Simply because the Crowne Plaza and Coogee made us feel at home, a place where we could relax, a base from which we could explore Sydney and eastern New South Wales. Would have stayed in Coogee so long, had we had been at another hotel? possibly not. It was for us the perfect hotel, the courteous friendly staff, the location, the expectations that each new day brought, the beach and surf, the seaside cliff top paths and the good old village of Coogee. But we have most of all, wonderful memories of the sunrise pouring into the room, the soft sea breezes cooling the night and the constant quiet rolling of the surf. We will return to Coogee and to the Crowne Plaza.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: 銇仯銇嶃倞瑷€銇ｃ仸銈兗銈?..   showReview(19924921, 'full');
Reviews.Author: lass=

Reviews.Content: 涓績閮ㄣ伀銇傘倠楂樸亜銉涖儐...   showReview(19918855, 'full');
Reviews.Author: lass=
